author: Timothy Rapp
title: Latest Updates on Giants TE Daniel Fells
text:
Latest Updates on Giants TE Daniel Fells Bleacher Report 8 hrs ago Timothy Rapp Â© Ronald Martinez/Getty Images New York Giants tight end Daniel Fells will miss the remainder of the season after being infected with MRSA that required "multiple surgeries," according to Jordan Raanan of NJ.com on Oct. 5.
AdChoices Doctors are hoping to avoid amputating his foot, NFL .com's Ian Rapoport reported on Oct. 11.
Continue for updates.
Latest on Fells' Condition Tuesday, Oct. 13 ESPN's Dan Graziano reported, per ABC News, that doctors are optimistic they can avoid amputation and " are hopeful his current course of antibiotics can continue to have the positive effect it's had over the past few days."
Rapoport reported Fells did not have a fever Sunday night for the first night in 10 days after he received new medication. On Sunday, Rapoport reported Fells was placed in the intensive care unit Friday but then "moved to a private room to have a nurse focus solely on his care." He added:
Fells has had five surgeries, according to a person with knowledge of his condition. More are coming, as doctors try to stave off further infection. As of Saturday night, they were fighting to save his foot, which is at risk given the nature of the infection. ...
The situation arose, the source said, when Fells suffered a toe injury, then an ankle injury. To treat it, Fells was given a cortisone shot. After a week of ankle and foot pain, Fells' wife took him to the emergency room on Oct. 2 with a 104-degree temperature. There, they found his ankle was infected with MRSA, a dangerous staph infection that is resistant to many antibiotics.
With doctors hoping to avoid amputating his foot, the more urgent fear is that the MRSA has gotten into the bone and that it could travel into his blood. That could have the gravest of consequences.
Kimberly Jones of NFL.com noted recent MRIs have been "clean."
Coughlin Comments on Fells' Recovery Monday, Oct. 12 Following the Giants' win in Week 5 against the San Francisco 49ers, Giants head coach Tom Coughlin announced at his press conference, "Fells is making progress for the third day in a row. Two to three nights in a row of good sleep. We dedicated the game to Daniel Fells. On Skype in our team meeting today, we showed him the game ball."
Coughlin originally expected Fells to be released from the hospital by Oct. 8, according to Raanan .
Fells Placed on Injured Reserve Wednesday, Oct. 7 The Giants announced they placed Fells on season-ending injured reserve and signed wide receiver Myles White from their practice squad.
Fells, 32, had six receptions for 60 yards this season. He was in his second year with the Giants and accumulated 16 receptions for 188 yards and four touchdowns with the team last year.
